page.title: 07A FARMER'S WIFE'S DAY
page.content: This morning we went to Marsh Farm and we went in two groups and my group was talking to the farmer's wife. She gets up at 7am and she cleans the kitchen. Then she gets the breakfast for the family and for the visitors. They have breakfast at nine o'clock. Afterwards the farmers wife does a lot of baking for the afternoon tea in the small cafe. They have lunch time about one o'clock. Then they prepare tables for tea. At four o'clock they prepare the food and serve teas. Afterwards she does the tidying up and the washing up. Then it is teatime for the family. They watch TV at eight thirty and the farmer's wife sometimes feeds the horses and ponies, the calves, hens and cows and she has turkeys at Christmas.
